features.name: Sneak Attack
features.desc:
If a character can catch an opponent when he is unable to defend himself effectively from her {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, she can strike a vital spot for extra {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
The character's attack deals extra damage anytime her target would be denied a {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} (whether the target actually has a Dexterity bonus or not), or when the character {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanks{/g} her target. This extra damage is {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} and increases by 1d6 at later levels. This additional damage is precision damage and is not multiplied on a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}.
The character must be able to see the target well enough to pick out a vital spot and must be able to {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} such a spot.

features.name: Poison Use
features.desc:
Assassins specialize in poison use. Every day they create special combat poisons, the number of their doses equal to 3 + assassin level, which they can use to envenom their melee weapons. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}, an assassin can apply one of the poisons to their melee weapon, and the next successful {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} applies it to the target. {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Save{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of all poisons is 10 + assassin level + {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Int{/g} modifier. If the attack that applied the poison was a sneak attack, the DC is increased by 2.
At 1st level, an assassin has access to poisons that deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} stat {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} for 4 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}.
At 3rd and 7th levels, the duration of the poisons increases by 1 round.
At 5th level, an assassin gains access to poison that deals {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} damage.
At 9th level, the number of successful saving throws needed to remove the poison increases to 2.
At 10th level, an assassin can apply the poisons as a move or a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.

features.name: Death Attack
features.desc:
An assassin can make a special {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} with a melee weapon against a target that doesn't know about the assassin. The attack has the additional effect of possibly either paralyzing or killing the target (assassin's choice). {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}Death{/g} attack is a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g}. The death attack fails if the target detects the assassin or recognizes the assassin as an enemy. If the victim of such a death attack fails a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + the assassin's {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} + the assassin's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Int{/g} modifier) against the kill effect, they die. If the saving throw fails against the paralysis effect, the victim is rendered {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g} and unable to act for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} plus 1 round per level of the assassin. If the victim's saving throw succeeds, the attack is just a normal attack.
At 10th level, the death attack becomes a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}.

features.name: Assassin Proficiencies
features.desc: Assassins are proficient with the crossbow, dagger, rapier, shortbow, and shortsword. Assassins are proficient with light armor but not with shields.

features.name: Save Bonus Against Poison
features.desc: At 2nd level, the assassin gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against poisons. This bonus increases by +1 every two levels.

features.name: Uncanny Dodge
features.desc:
The character can react to danger before her senses would normally allow her to do so. She cannot be caught {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g}, nor does she lose her {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} if the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacker{/g} is invisible. She still loses her Dexterity bonus to AC if immobilized. A character with this ability can still lose her Dexterity bonus to AC if an opponent successfully uses the feint {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} against her.
If a character already has uncanny dodge from a different class, she automatically gains improved uncanny dodge instead.

features.name: Poison Use — Increased Duration
features.desc: At 3rd and 7th level, the duration of the poisons increases by 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.

features.name: Poison Use — Constitution
features.desc: At 5th level, an assassin gains access to poison that deals {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.

features.name: Hide In Plain Sight
features.desc: At 8th level, an assassin can use the {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} even while being observed. An assassin can hide himself from view in the open without having anything to actually hide behind.

features.name: Poison Use — Increased Successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Saves{/g} to Remove
features.desc: At 9th level, the number of successes needed to remove the poison increases to 2.

features.name: Poison Use — Swift
features.desc: At 10th level, an assassin can apply the poisons as a move or a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.

features.name: Death Attack — Standard
features.desc: At 10th level, the {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} becomes a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}.

name: Assassin
desc: A mercenary undertaking his task with cold, professional detachment, the assassin is equally adept at espionage, bounty hunting, and terrorism. At his core, an assassin is an artisan, and his medium is {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death{/g}. Trained in a variety of killing techniques, assassins are among the most feared classes.
